quote: Prayer  among sane people  has never superseded practical efforts to secure the desired end.
author: George Santayana

quote: It is vain to expect our prayers to be heard if we do not strive as well as pray.
author: Aesop

quote: He who labors as he prays lifts his heart to God with his hands.
author: Bernard of Clairvaux

quote: Pray as if everything depended on God  and work as if everything depended upon man.
author: Archbishop Francis J. Spellman

quote: Work as if everything depended upon work and pray as if everything depended upon prayer.
author: William Booth

quote: Help yourself and heaven will help you.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: Work as if you were to live one hundred years  pray as if you were to die tomorrow.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: God helps those who help themselves.
author: German proverb

quote: God help those who do not help themselves.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: God gives the nuts  but he does not crack them.
author: German proverb

quote: God gives every bird its food  but he does not throw it into the nest.
author: Josiah G. Holland

quote: Pray devoutly  but hammer stoutly.
author: Sir William Gurney Benham

quote: The Ancient Mariner said to Neptune during a great storm  "O God  you will save me if you wish  but I am going to go on holding my tiller straight."
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Pray to God  but keep rowing to shore.
author: Russian proverb

quote: Call on God  but row away from the rocks.
author: Indian proverb

quote: To the man who himself strives earnestly  God also lends a helping hand.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Trust in Allah  but tie your camel first.
author: Arab proverb

quote: It is vain to ask of the gods what man is capable of supplying for himself.
author: Epicurus

quote: Heaven ne'er helps the men who will not act.
author: Sophocles

quote: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single kind act is better than a thousand head-bowings in prayer.
author: Sa'di

quote: Always look for ways to act upon the faith you display in your prayers.
author: Anonymous

quote: You can do more than pray after you have prayed  but you cannot do more than pray until you have prayed.
author: A. J. Gordon

quote: Visualize  "prayerize " "actionize " and your wishes will come true.
author: Charles L. Allen

quote: There is a time for all things  a time to preach and a time to pray  but those times have passed away  there is a time to fight  and that time has come!
author: General Peter Muhlenberg

quote: Prayer is often a temptation to bank on a miracle of God instead of on a moral issue  i.e.  it is much easier to ask God to do my work than it is to do it myself. Until we are disciplined properly  we will always be inclined to bank on God's miracles and refuse to do the moral thing ourselves. It is our job  and it will never be done unless we do it.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: Some people think that prayer just means asking for things  and if they fail to receive exactly what they asked for  they think the whole thing is a fraud.
author: Gerald Vann

quote: Poverty  chastity  and obedience are extremely difficult. But there are always the graces if you will pray for them.
author: Katheryn Hulme

quote: Real prayer seeks an audience and an answer.
author: William S. Plumer

quote: There are three answers to prayer: yes  no  and wait awhile. It must be recognized that no is an answer.
author: Ruth Stafford Peale

quote: There are four ways God answers prayer: No  not yet  No  I love you too much  Yes  I thought you'd never ask  Yes  and here's more.
author: Anne Lewis

quote: No answer to prayer is an indication of our merit  every answer to prayer is an indication of God's mercy.
author: John Blanchard

quote: God answers all true prayer  either in kind or in kindness.
author: Adoniram Judson

quote: God is not a cosmic bellboy for whom we can press a button to get things.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: More things are wrought by prayer than this world dreams of.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quote: When I have a problem I pray about it  and what comes to mind and stays there I assume to be my answer. And this has been right so often that I know it is God's answer.
author: J. L. Kraft

quote: Whenever the insistence is on the point that God answers prayer  we are off the track. The meaning of prayer is that we get hold of God  not of the answer.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: I think Christians fail so often to get answers to their prayers because they do not wait long enough on God. They just drop down and say a few words  and then jump up and forget it and expect God to answer them. Such praying always reminds me of the small boy ringing his neighbor's door-bell  and then running away as fast as he can go.
author: E. M. Bounds

quote: When I pray  coincidences happen  and when I don't  they don't.
author: William Temple

quote: Our understanding of God is the answer to prayer  getting things from God is God's indulgence of us. When God stops giving us things  He brings us into the place where we can begin to understand Him.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: If God sees that my spiritual life will be furthered by giving the things for which I ask  then He will give them  but that is not the end of prayer. The end of prayer is that I come to know God Himself.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: You say  "But He has not answered." He has  He is so near to you that His silence is the answer. His silence is big with terrific meaning that you cannot understand yet  but presently you will.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: When we pray "in the Name of Jesus" the answers are in accordance with His nature  and if we think our prayers are unanswered it is because we are not interpreting the answer along this line.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: God's silences are His answers. If we only take as answers those that are visible to our senses  we are in a very elementary condition of grace.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: Who rises from prayer a better man  his prayer is answered.
author: George Meredith

quote: God has editing rights over our prayers. He will... edit them  correct them  bring them in line with His will and then hand them back to us to be resubmitted.
author: Stephen Crotts

quote: The great tragedy of life is not unanswered prayer  but unoffered prayer.
author: KB. Meyer

quote: My prayers  my God  flow from what I am not  I think Thy answers make me what I am.
author: George Macdonald

quote: The greatest blessing of prayer is not receiving the answer  but being the kind of person God can trust with His answer.
author: Anonymous

quote: God answers prayer with certainty. Wish fulfillment is something else.
author: Anonymous

quote: God delays  but doesn't forget.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: A generous prayer is never presented in vain  the petition may be refused  but the petitioner is always  I believe  rewarded by some gracious visitation.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: I tremble for my country when I reflect that God is just.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The answer of our prayers is secured by the fact that in rejecting them God would in a certain sense deny His own nature.
author: John Calvin

quote: There are two main pitfalls on the road to mastery of the art of prayer. If a person gets what he asks for  his humility is in danger. If he fails to get what he asks for  he is apt to lose confidence. Indeed  no matter whether prayer seems to be succeeding or failing  humility and confidence are two virtues which are absolutely essential.
author: Anonymous

quote: If we be empty and poor  it is not because God's hand is straitened  but ours is not opened.
author: Thomas Manton

quote: I firmly believe a great many prayers are not answered because we are not willing to forgive someone.
author: Dwight L. Moody

quote: I know not by what methods rare  But this I know: God answers prayer. I know not if the blessing sought Will come in just the guise I thought. I leave my prayer to Him alone Whose will is wiser than my own.
author: Eliza M. Hickok

quote: Our prayers are often filled with selfish "wants"  God always answers with what we need.
author: Anonymous

quote: We ought not to tolerate for a minute the ghastly and grievous thought that God will not answer prayer.
author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

quote: Though I am weak  yet God  when prayed  Cannot withhold his conquering aid.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Beyond our utmost wants His love and power can bless  To praying souls he always grants More than they can express.
author: John Newton

quote: Whatever things ye desire  when ye pray  believe that you receive them  and ye shall have them.
author: Bible

quote: The firmament of the Bible is ablaze with answers to prayer.
author: T. L. Cuyler

quote: Never was a faithful prayer lost. Some prayers have a longer voyage than others  but then they return with their richer lading at last  so that the praying soul is a gainer by waiting for an answer.
author: William Gurnall

quote: In Gethsemane the holiest of all petitioners prayed three times that a certain cup might pass from Him. It did not. After that the idea that prayer is recommended to us as a sort of infallible gimmick may be dismissed.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Sometimes ... God answers our prayers in the way our parents do  who reply to the pleas of their children with "Not just now" or "I'll have to think about that for a little while."
author: Roy M. Pearson

quote: Answered prayers cover the field of providential history as flowers cover western prairies.
author: T. L. Cuyler

quote: In seasons of distress and grief  My soul has often found relief  And oft escaped the tempter's snare  By thy return  sweet hour of prayer.
author: W. W. Walford

quote: God answers sharp and sudden on some prayers  And thrusts the thing we have prayed for in our face. A gauntlet with a gift in't.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: Our prayers run along one road and God's answers by another  and by and by they meet.
author: Adoniram Judson

quote: God's chief gift to those who seek him is Himself.
author: E. B. Pusey

quote: Asking for anything is allowed with the understanding that God's answers come from God's perspective. They are not always in harmony with our expectations  for only He knows the whole story.
author: Anonymous

quote: May the Lord answer you when you are in distress  May the name of the God of Jacob protect you  May he send you help from the sanctuary and grant you support from Zion.
author: Bible

quote: Just when I need Him  He is my all  Answering when upon Him I call  Tenderly watching lest I should fall.
author: William Poole

quote: The king shall joy in thy strength  O Lord  and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice! Thou hast given him his heart's desire  and hast not withheld the request of his lips.
author: Bible

quote: Those who trade with heaven by prayer grow rich by quick returns.
author: William S. Plumer

quote: The great thing in prayer is to feel that we are putting our supplications into the bosom of omnipotent love.
author: Andrew Murray

quote: When you go to your knees  God will help you stand up to anything.
author: Anonymous

quote: Prayer has marked the trees across the wilderness of a skeptical world to direct the traveler in distress  and all paths lead to a single light.
author: Douglas Meador

quote: Amazing things start happening when we start praying!
author: Anonymous

quote: Prayer enlarges the heart until it is capable of containing God's gift of Himself.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: The man who prays grows  and the muscles of the soul swell from this whipcord to iron bands.
author: F. B. Meyer

quote: Prayer opens our eyes that we may see ourselves and others as God sees us.
author: Clara Palmer

quote: It is impossible to lose your footing while on your knees.
author: Anonymous

quote: The exercise of prayer  in those who habitually exert it  must be regarded by us doctors as the most adequate and normal of all the pacifiers of the mind and calmers of the nerves.
author: William James

quote: The influence of prayer on the human mind and body ... can be measured in terms of increased physical buoyancy  greater intellectual vigor  moral stamina  and a deeper understanding of the realities underlying human relationships.
author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

quote: The essence of prayer  even of a mystical experience  is the way we are altered to see everything from its life-filled dimension.
author: Matthew Fox

quote: Prayer puts God's work in His hands-and keeps it there.
author: E. M. Bounds

quote: It is hard to wait and press and pray  and hear no voice  but stay till God answers.
author: E. M. Bounds

quote: Prayer is a kind of calling home every day. And there can come to you a serenity  a feeling of at-homeness in God's universe  a peace that the world can neither give nor disturb  a fresh courage  a new insight  a holy boldness that you'll never  never get any other way.
author: Earl G. Hunt

quote: Pray because you have a Father  not because it quietens you  and give Him time to answer.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: Perhaps one of the greatest rewards of meditation and prayer is the sense of belonging that comes to us.
author: Bill W.

quote: We impoverish God in our minds when we say there must be answers to our prayers on the material plane  the biggest answers to our prayers are in the realm of the unseen.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: Our Lord never referred to unanswered prayer  he taught that prayers are always answered. He ever implied that prayers were answered rightly because of the Heavenly Father's wisdom.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: As white snow flakes fall quietly and thickly on a winter day  answers to prayer will settle down upon you at every step you take  even to your dying day. The story of your life will be the story of prayer and answers to prayer.
author: O. Hallesby

quote: God is a rich and bountiful Father  and He does not forget His children  nor withhold from them anything which it would be to their advantage to receive.
author: J. K. Maclean

quote: Just as an earthly father knows what is best for his children's welfare  so does God take into consideration the particular needs of His human family  and meets them out of His wonderful storehouse.
author: J. K. Maclean

quote: Prayer brings a good spirit in our homes. For God hears prayer. Heaven itself would come down to our homes. And even though we who constitute the home all have our imperfections and our failings  our home would  through God's answer to prayer  become a little paradise.
author: O. Hallesby

quote: God's willingness to answer our prayers exceeds our willingness to give good and necessary things to our children  just as far as God's ability  goodness and perfection exceed our infirmities and evil.
author: E. M. Bounds

quote: The greatest answer to prayer is that I am brought into a perfect understanding with God  and that alters my view of actual things.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: God's "nothings" are His most positive answers. We have to stay on God and wait. Never try to help God to fulfill His word.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: The shower of answers to your prayers will continue to your dying hour. Nor will it cease then. When you pass out from beneath the shower  your dear ones will step into it. Every prayer and every sigh which you have uttered for them and their future welfare will  in God's time  descend upon them as a gentle rain of answers to prayer.
author: O. Hallesby

quote: If a door slams shut it means that God is pointing to an open door further on down.
author: Anna Delaney Peale

quote: We  ignorant of ourselves  beg often our own harms  which the wise powers deny us for our good.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Prayer is the easiest and hardest of all things  the simplest and the sublim-est  the weakest and the most powerful  its results lie outside the range of human possibilities-they are limited only by the omnipotence of God.
author: E. M. Bounds

quote: Prayer  like faith  obtains promises  enlarges their operation  and adds to the measure of their results.
author: E. M. Bounds

quote: If we will make use of prayer to call down upon ourselves and others those things which will glorify the name of God  then we shall see the strongest and boldest promises of the Bible about prayer fulfilled. Then we shall see such answers to prayer as we had never thought were possible.
author: O. Hallesby

quote: Let it be your business every day  in the secrecy of the inner chamber  to meet the holy God. You will be repaid for the trouble it may cost you. The reward will be sure and rich.
author: Andrew Murray

quote: One great effect of prayer is that it enables the soul to command the body. By obedience I make my body submissive to my soul  but prayer puts my soul in command of my body.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: If we pray for anything according to the will of God  we already have what we pray for the moment we ask it. We do not know exactly when it will arrive  but we have learned to know God through the Spirit of God  and have learned to leave this in His hands  and to live just as happily whether the answer arrives immediately or later.
author: O. Hallesby

quote: It is God's will not only to hear our prayer  but to give us the best and the richest answer which He  the almighty and omniscient God  can devise. He will send us the answer when it will benefit us and His cause the most.
author: O. Hallesby

quote: If God does not give you something you ask for  wait on Him. He will speak with you tenderly and sympathetically about the matter until you yourself understand that He cannot grant your prayer.
author: O. Hallesby

quote: The potency of prayer hath subdued the strength of fire  it hath bridled the rage of lions  hushed anarchy to rest  extinguished wars  appeased the elements  expelled demons  burst the chains of death  expanded the gates of heaven  assuaged diseases  repelled frauds  rescued cities from destruction  stayed the sun in its course  and arrested the progress of the thunderbolt.
author: Saint John Chrysostom

quote: Be sure to remember that nothing in your daily life is so insignificant and so inconsequential that the Lord will not help you by answering your prayer.
author: O. Hallesby

quote: More tears are shed over answered prayers than unanswered ones.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: True prayer always receives what it asks for-or something better.
author: Bryon Edwards

quote: Be thankful that God's answers are wiser than your answers.
author: William Culbertson

quote: God punishes us mildly by ignoring our prayers  and severely by answering them.
author: Richard J. Needham

quote: When the gods wish to punish us  they answer our prayers.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: God alone fully understands what each one of us needs  we make mistakes continually and pray for things which would be harmful to us if we received them. Afterwards we see our mistakes and realize that God is good and wise in not giving us these things  even though we plead ever so earnestly for them.
author: O. Hallesby

quote: When the gods are angry with a man  they give him what he asks for.
author: Greek proverb

quote: I have lived to thank God that all my prayers have not been answered.
author: Jean Ingelow

quote: Prayer is the supreme activity of all that is noblest in our personality  and the essential nature of prayer is faith.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: Prayer is the voice of faith.
author: William Van Home

quote: The prayer that is faithless is fruitless.
author: Thomas Watson

quote: A saint is to put forth his faith in prayer  and afterwards follow his prayer with faith.
author: Vavasor Powell

quote: The prayer of faith is the only power in the universe to which the great Jehovah yields.
author: Robert Hall

quote: Prayers are heard in heaven very much in proportion to your faith. Little faith will get very great mercies  but great faith still greater.
author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

quote: The beginning of anxiety is the end of faith  and the beginning of true faith is the end of anxiety.
author: George Mueller

quote: Teach me  O God  not to torture myself  not to make a martyr out of myself through stifling reflection  but rather teach me to breathe deeply in faith.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Faith is the fountain of prayer  and prayer should be nothing else but faith exercised.
author: Thomas Manton

quote: Without faith it is impossible to please God  for he that cometh to God must believe that He is.
author: Bible

quote: When we pray we link ourselves with an inexhaustible motive power.
author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

quote: Jesus Christ is a God whom we approach without pride  and before whom we humble ourselves without despair.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Granting that we are always in the presence of God  yet it seems to me that those who pray are in His presence in a very different sense  for they  as it were  see that He is looking upon them  while others may go for days on end without even once recollecting that God sees them.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: Why is it when we talk to God we're said to be praying  but when God talks to us we're schizophrenic?
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: It is in recognizing the actual presence of God that we find prayer no longer a chore  but a supreme delight.
author: Gordon Lindsay

quote: Essentially prayer is based on a relationship. We don't converse freely with someone we don't know. We bare our souls and disclose our hidden secrets only to someone we trust.
author: Dean Register

quote: I who still pray at morning and at eve Thrice in my life perhaps have truly prayed  Thrice stirred below conscious self Have felt that perfect disenthrallment which is God.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Prayer is the soul's breathing itself into the bosom of its heavenly Father.
author: Thomas Watson

quote: Prayer is a shield to the soul  a sacrifice to God  and a scourge for Satan.
author: John Bunyan

quote: Prayer is the spiritual gymnasium in which we exercise and practice godliness.
author: V. L. Crawford

quote: Prayer is exhaling the spirit of man and inhaling the spirit of God.
author: Edwin Keith

quote: Prayer is the acid test of devotion.
author: Samuel Chadwick

quote: Prayer serves as an edge and border to preserve the web of life from unraveling.
author: Robert Hall

quote: Prayer is the ascending vapor which supplies The showers of blessing  and the stream that flows Through earth's dry places  till on every side "The wilderness shall blossom as the rose."
author: A. B. Simpson

quote: Prayer is a rising up and a drawing near to God in mind and in heart  and in spirit.
author: Alexander Whyte

quote: Prayer means that we have come boldly into the throne room and we are standing in His presence.
author: E. W. Kenyon

quote: Prayer is the contemplation of the facts of life from the highest point of view.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Prayer does not mean simply to pour out one's heart. It means rather to find the way to God and to speak with him  whether the heart is full or empty.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quote: Prayer is not an exercise  it is the life.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: Prayer is our most formidable weapon  the thing which makes all else we do efficient.
author: E. M. Bounds

quote: Prayer is not logical  it is a mysterious moral working of the Holy Spirit.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: Prayer should be the means by which I  at all times  receive all that I need  and  for this reason  be my daily refuge  my daily consolation  my daily joy  my source of rich and inexhaustible joy in life.
author: Saint John Chrysostom

quote: Prayer is the spirit speaking truth to Truth.
author: Philip James Bailey

quote: Prayer is a cry of distress  a demand for help  a hymn of love.
author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

quote: Prayer  in its simplest definition  is merely a wish turned God-ward.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: Prayer is the evidence that I am spiritually concentrated on God.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: Prayer is the pillow of religion.
author: Arab proverb

quote: Prayer is God's answer to our poverty  not a power we exercise to obtain an answer.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: Prayer is a condition of mind  an attitude of heart  which God recognizes as prayer whether it manifests itself in quiet thinking  in sighing or in audible words.
author: O. Hallesby

quote: Prayer is an all-efficient panoply  a treasure undiminished  a mine which is never exhausted  a sky unobscured by clouds  a heaven unruffled by the storm. It is the root  the fountain  the mother of a thousand blessings.
author: Saint John Chrysostom

quote: Some pray to marry the man they love  my prayer will somewhat vary  I humbly pray to Heaven above that I love the man I marry.
author: Rose Pastor Stokes

quote: The prayers of the Christian are secret  but their effect cannot be hidden.
author: Howard Chandler Robbins

quote: Man is the only creature which rises by bowing  for he finds elevation in his subjection to his Maker.
author: Anonymous

quote: Lord  till I reach that blissful shore  No privilege so dear shall be As thus my inmost soul to pour In prayer to thee.
author: Charlotte Elliott

quote: Revival fires flame where hearts are praying.
author: Dick Eastman

quote: If we could all hear one another's prayers  God might be relieved of some of his burden.
author: Ashleigh Brilliant

quote: What I dislike least in my former self are the moments of prayer.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Our rages  daughters of despair  creep and squirm like worms. Prayer is the only form of revolt which remains upright.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: Prayer reaches out in love to a dying world and says  "I care."
author: Dick Eastman

quote: To pray together  in whatever tongue or ritual  is the most tender brotherhood of hope and sympathy that man can contract in this life.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: The deepest wishes of the heart find expression in secret prayer.
author: George E. Rees

quote: We are never more like Christ than in prayers of intercession.
author: Austin Phelps

quote: The spirit of prayer is the fruit and token of the Spirit of adoption.
author: John Newton

quote: If we do not love one another  we certainly shall not have much power with God in prayer.
author: Dwight L. Moody

quote: Keep us  Lord  so awake in the duties of our calling that we may sleep in thy peace and wake in thy glory.
author: John Donne

quote: I find in the Psalms much the same range of mood and expression as I perceive within my own life of prayer.
author: Malcolm Boyd

quote: I am used to praying when I am alone  thank God. But when I come together with other people  when I need more than ever to pray  I still cannot get used to it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Nothing is discussed more and practiced less than prayer.
author: Anonymous

quote: I always love to begin a journey on Sundays  because I shall have the prayers of the church to preserve all that travel by land  or by water.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Nor it is an objection to say that we must understand a prayer if it is to have its true effect. That simply is not the case. Who understands the wisdom of a flower? Yet we can take pleasure in it.
author: Rudolph Steiner

quote: I would rather stand against the cannons of the wicked than against the prayers of the righteous.
author: Thomas Lye

quote: Restraining prayer  we cease to fight  Prayer keeps the Christian's armor bright  And Satan trembles when he sees The weakest saint upon his knees.
author: William Cowper

quote: God dwells where we let God in.
author: Menachem Mendel

quote: Courage is not afraid to weep  and she is not afraid to pray  even when she is not sure who she is praying to.
author: J. Ruth Gendler

quote: Saints of the early church reaped great harvests in the field of prayer and found the mercy seat to be a mine of untold treasures.
author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: The wings of prayer carry high and far.
author: Anonymous

quote: In the calm of sweet communion Let thy daily work be done  In the peace of soul-outpouring Care be banished  patience won  And if earth with its enchantments Seek thy spirit to enthrall  Ere thou listen  ere thou answer  Turn to Jesus  tell Him all.
author: G. M. Taylor

quote: God warms his hands at man's heart when he prays.
author: John Masefield

author: Mark R. Litteton

author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

author: Phillips Brooks

quote: They never sought in vain that sought the Lord aright!

quote: Prayer is the voice of faith.

author: Kahlil Gibran

author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: He that will learn to pray  let him go to Sea.
author: George Edward Herbert

quote: O God  if in the day of battle I forget Thee  do not Thou forget me.
author: William King

quote: If I am right  Thy grace impart  Still in the right to stay  If I am wrong  O teach my heart To find that better way!
author: Alexander Pope

author: Matthew

quote: God warms his hands at man's heart when he prays.
author: John Masefield

quote: Every one that asketh receiveth  and he that seeketh findeth.
author: Matthew

author: Socrates

quote: Ask  and it shall be given you  seek and ye shall find  knock  and it shall be opened unto you.
author: Matthew

author: Francis Cardinal Spellman

quote: Give us the strength to encounter that which is to come  that we may be brave in peril  constant in tribulation  temperate in wrath  and in all changes of fortune  and down to the gates of death  loyal and loving one to anther.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

author: John Newton

quote: Do as we say  and not as we do.
author: Giovanni Boccaccio

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

author: Francois Fenelon

author: St. Francis de Sales

quote: But in his duty prompt at every call  He watch'd and wept  he pray'd and felt for all.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

author: Samuel Johnson

author: Martin Luther

author: George Sandys

quote: Sermons in stones and good in every thing.
author: William Shakespeare

author: Anonymous

author: Henry B. Whipple

author: Jewish proverb

author: Bernard M. Baruch

author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

author: Robert Benchley

author: Oscar Levant

quote: Once you sink that first stake  they'll never make you pull it up.
author: Robert Moses

quote: A great devotee of the gospel of getting on.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The century on which we are entering can be and must be the century of the common man.

quote: To spur a willing horse.
author: Latin proverb

quote: Is it progress if a cannibal uses knife and fork?

quote: If you want a place in the sun  you've got to put up with a few blisters.
author: Abigail Van Buren

quote: Never let life's hardships disturb you ... no one can avoid problems  not even saints or sages.
author: Nichiren Daishonen

quote: Life is made up of sobs  sniffles  and smiles  with sniffles predominating.
author: O. Henry

quote: The scornful nostril and the high head gather not the odors that lie on the track of truth.
author: George Eliot

quote: Expecting the world to treat you fairly because you are a good person is a little like expecting the bull not to attack you because you're a vegetarian.
author: Dennis Wholey

quote: When nobody around you seems to measure up  it's time to check your yardstick.
author: Bill Lemley

quote: Life to the great majority is only a constant struggle for mere existence  with the certainty of losing it at last.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Marriage is not just spiritual communion and passionate embraces  marriage is also three meals a day  sharing the workload and remembering to carry out the trash.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: We [Americans] cheerfully assume that in some mystic way love conquers all  that good outweighs evil in the just balances of the universe and that at the eleventh hour something gloriously triumphant will prevent the worst before it happens.
author: Brooks Atkinson

quote: There is no such thing as something for nothing.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Free man is by necessity insecure  thinking man is by necessity uncertain.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: It is arrogance to expect that life will always be music.... Harmony  like a following breeze at sea  is the exception. In a world where most things wind up broken or lost  our lot is to tack and tune.
author: Harvey Oxenhorn

quote: Being unready and ill-equipped is what you have to expect in life. It is the universal predicament. It is your lot as a human being to lack what it takes. Circumstances are seldom right. You never have the capacities  the strength  the wisdom  the virtue you ought to have. You must always do with less than you need in a situation vastly different from what you would have chosen as appropriate for your special endowments.
author: Charlton Ogburn

quote: In nature there are neither rewards or punishments-there are consequences.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: Hope for a miracle. But don't depend on one.
author: Talmud

quote: Life guarantees a chance-not a fair shake.
author: Anonymous

quote: Life is a perilous voyage.
author: Palladas

quote: One must not hope to be more than one can be.
author: Nicolas de Chamfort

quote: The whole point of getting things done is knowing what to leave undone.
author: Lady Stella Reading

quote: We expect more of ourselves than we have any right to.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Don't fool yourself that you are going to have it all. You are not. Psychologically  having it all is not even a valid concept. The marvelous thing about human beings is that we are perpetually reaching for the stars. The more we have  the more we want. And for this reason  we never have it all.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: Try as hard as we may for perfection  the net result of our labors is an amazing variety of imperfectness. We are surprised at our own versatility in being able to fail in so many different ways.
author: Samuel McChord Crothers

quote: We set up harsh and unkind rules against ourselves. No one is born without faults. That man is best who has fewest.
author: Horace

quote: I can't write a book commensurate with Shakespeare  but I can write a book by me.
author: Sir Walter Raleigh

quote: I have done what I could do in life  and if I could not do better  I did not deserve it. In vain I have tried to step beyond what bound me.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: Shall a man go and hang himself because he belongs to the race of pygmies  and not be the biggest pygmy that he can?
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The man with insight enough to admit his limitations comes nearest to perfection.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: The one important thing I have learned over the years is the difference between taking one's work seriously and taking one's self seriously. The first is imperative  and the second is disastrous.
author: Margaret Fontey

quote: Growth begins when we start to accept our own weakness.
author: Jean Vanier

quote: To dream of the person you would like to be is to waste the person you are.
author: Anonymous

quote: Of all the young men in America  only a few hundred can get into major league baseball  and of these only a handful in a decade can get into the Hall of Fame. So it goes in all human activity. ... Some become multimillionaires and chairmen of the board  and some of us must be content to play baseball at company picnics or manage a credit union without pay.
author: William Feather

quote: At thirty a man should know himself like the palm of his hand  know the exact number of his defects and qualities. ... And  above all  accept these things.
author: Albert Camus

quote: No man can climb out beyond the limitations of his own character.
author: John Morley

quote: You can't make the Duchess of Windsor into Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm. The facts of life are very stubborn things.
author: Cleveland Amory

quote: Sometimes it is more important to discover what one cannot do  than what one can do.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: Learn to ... be what you are  and learn to resign with a good grace all that you are not.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: We cannot all be masters.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: To do all that one is able to do is to be a man  to do all that one would like to do is to be a god.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: No one is expected to achieve the impossible.
author: French proverb

quote: A hero is a man who does what he can.
author: Romain Rolland

quote: It is only fools who keep straining at high C all their lives.
author: Charles Dudley Warner

quote: May God ... let me strive for attainable things.
author: Pindar

quote: Despair is the price one pays for setting himself an impossible aim.
author: Graham Greene

quote: We would have to settle for the elegant goal of becoming ourselves.
author: William Styron

quote: A great obstacle to happiness is to expect too much happiness.
author: Bernard de Fontenelle

quote: There is a proper balance between not asking enough of oneself and asking or expecting too much.
author: May Sarton

quote: I hope to work  support my children and die quietly without pain.
author: Sean Connery

quote: As we advance in life  we learn the limits of our abilities.
author: J. A. Froude

quote: Striving for excellence motivates you  striving for perfection is demoralizing.
author: Dr. Harriet Braiker

quote: It is enough that I am of value to somebody today.
author: Hugh Prather

quote: A tomb now suffices him for whom the whole world was not sufficient.
author: Alexander the Great

quote: To wish to act like angels while we are still in this world is nothing but folly.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: It isn't important to come out on top  what matters is to be the one who comes out alive.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task  but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
author: Helen Keller

quote: I cannot do everything  but still I can do something  and because I cannot do everything  I will not refuse to do something I can do.
author: Edward Everett Hale

quote: Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

quote: Happy the man who early learns the wide chasm that lies between his wishes and his powers.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: [Being a parent] is tough. If you just want a wonderful little creature to love  you can get a puppy.
author: Barbara Walters

quote: You never conquer a mountain. You stand on the summit a few moments  then the wind blows your footprints away.
author: Arlene Blum

quote: If we are to survive on this planet  there must be compromises.
author: Storm Jameson

quote: Real life is  to most men ... a perpetual compromise between the ideal and the possible.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: He who cannot do what he wants must make do with what he can.
author: Terence

quote: What has always made a hell on earth has been that man has tried to make it his heaven.
author: Friedrich Holderlin

quote: Good is not good  where better is expected.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Nobody has things just as he would like them. The thing to do is to make a success with what material I have. It is a sheer waste of time and soul-power to imagine what I would do if things were different. They are not different.
author: Dr. Frank Crane

quote: People are lucky and unlucky ... according to the ratio between what they get and what they have been led to expect.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: We must like what we have when we don't have what we like.
author: Roger de Rabutin

quote: Better is the enemy of the good.
author: Voltaire

quote: If you aspire to the highest place  it is no disgrace to stop at the second  or even the third  place.
author: Cicero

quote: Genius does what it must  talent does what it can.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: A hero is a man who does what he can.
author: Romain Rolland

quote: Nature is what you may do. There is much you may not do.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Results are what you expect  consequences are what you get.
author: Anonymous

quote: The resistance to the unpleasant situation is the root of suffering.
author: Ram Dass

quote: To expect life to be tailored to our specifications is to invite frustration.
author: Anonymous

quote: Each of us does  in effect  strike a series of "deals " or compromises  between the wants and longings of the inner self  and an outer environment that offers certain possibilities and sets certain limitations.
author: Maggie Scarf

quote: Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps  for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are  and what they might have been.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: We do not write as we want  but as we can.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Every creator painfully experiences the chasm between his inner vision and its ultimate expression. The chasm is never completely bridged. We all have the conviction  perhaps illusory  that we have much more to say than appears on the paper.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: A body shouldn't heed what might be. He's got to do with what is.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: The chief pang of most trials is not so much the actual suffering itself as our own spirit of resistance to it.
author: Jean Nicholas Grou

quote: The greatest and most important problems in life are all in a certain sense insoluble. They can never be solved  but only outgrown.
author: Carl Jung

quote: The art of living lies less in eliminating our troubles than in growing with them.
author: Bernard M. Baruch

quote: Life has not taught me to expect nothing  but she has taught me not to expect success to be the inevitable result of my endeavors.
author: Alan Paton

quote: Knowledge of what is possible is the beginning of happiness.
author: George Santayana

quote: Don't spend time beating on a wall  hoping to transform it into a door.
author: Dr. Laura Schlessinger

quote: If I were to wish for anything  I should not wish for wealth and power  but for the passionate sense of the potential  for the eye which  ever young and ardent  sees the possible ... what wine is so sparkling  so fragrant  so intoxicating  as possibility!
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Wisdom never kicks at the iron walls it can't bring down.
author: Olive Schreiner

quote: It is impossible to control creation.
author: Evelyn Scott

quote: To seek fulfillment is to invite frustration.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: Half the unhappiness in the world is due to the failure of plans which were never reasonable  and often impossible.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: There is an illusion that has much to do with ... most of our unhappiness. ... We expect too much.
author: Joseph Farrell

quote: A fool or idiot is one who expects things to happen that never can happen.
author: George Eliot

quote: Shall a man go and hang himself because he belongs to the race of pygmies  and not be the biggest pygmy that he can?
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Life is a compromise of what your ego wants to do  what experience tells you to do  and what your nerves let you do.
author: Bruce Crampton

quote: No  Doctor  I don't want to grow young again. I just want to keep on growing old.
author: Madame de Rothschild

quote: What we call reality is an agreement that people have arrived at to make life more livable.
author: Louise Nevelson

quote: There is no such thing as pure pleasure  some anxiety always goes with it.
author: Ovid

quote: When somebody tells you nothing is impossible  ask him to dribble a football.
author: Anonymous

quote: No country can act wisely simultaneously in every part of the globe at every moment of time.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: The most important thing in marriage is not happiness  but stability.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quote: So often we search out the impossible  and then throw ourselves into trying to do it.
author: Anonymous

quote: Nothing is so good as it seems beforehand.
author: George Eliot

quote: Prospect is often better than possession.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: The hours we pass with happy prospects in view are more pleasing than those crowned with fruition.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: 'Tis expectation makes a blessing dear  heaven were not heaven if we knew what it were.
author: Sir John Sucking

quote: Life is so constructed that the event does not  cannot  will not  match the expectation.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: There is no greater enemy to those who would please than expectation.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: To dream too much of the person you would like to be is to waste the person you are.
author: Anonymous

quote: Too many people miss the silver lining because they're expecting gold.
author: Maurice Setter

quote: For people who live on expectations  to face up to their realization is something of an ordeal.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: My expectations-which I extended whenever I came close to accomplishing my goals-made it impossible ever to feel satisfied with my success.
author: Ellen Sue Stern

quote: Every attempt to make war easy and safe will result in humiliation and disaster.
author: General William Sherman

quote: I sincerely wish war was a pleasanter and easier business than it is  but it does not admit of holidays.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: There is many a boy here today who looks on war as all glory  but boys  it is all hell.
author: General William T. Sherman

quote: War is not an adventure. It is a disease. It is like typhus.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: In combat  life is short  nasty and brutish. The issues of national policy which brought him into war are irrelevant to the combat soldier  he is concerned with his literal life chances.
author: Charles E. Moskos

quote: In war  more than anywhere else in the world  things happen differently from what we had expected  and look differently when near from what they did at a distance.
author: Karl von Clausewitz

quote: In spite of all of the training you get and the precautions you take to keep yourself alive  it's largely a matter of luck that decides whether or not you get killed.
author: James Jones

quote: Moderation in war is imbecility.
author: Admiral John Fisher

quote: When one's expectations are reduced to zero  one really appreciates everything one does have.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: I like trees because they seem more resigned to the way they have to live than other things do.
author: Willa Cather

quote: Life didn't promise to be wonderful.
author: Teddy Pendergrass

quote: We never enjoy perfect happiness  our most fortunate successes are mingled with sadness  some anxieties always perplex the reality of our satisfaction.
author: Pierre Corneille

quote: Do not commit the error  common among the young  of assuming that if you cannot save the whole of mankind you have failed.
author: Jan de Hartog

quote: The art of living lies less in eliminating our troubles than in growing with them.
author: Bernard M. Baruch

quote: If one considered life as a simple loan  one would perhaps be less exacting.
author: Eugene Delacroix

quote: Why are we surprised when fig trees bear figs?
author: Margaret Titzel

quote: Those who aim at great deeds must also suffer greatly.
author: Plutarch

quote: I have nothing to offer but blood  toil  tears  and sweat.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: There's no map  there's no master plan  there's just people.
author: Stingray

quote: Every writer I know has trouble writing.
author: Joseph Heller

quote: Men expect too much  do too little.
author: Allen Tate

quote: Human kind cannot bear very much reality.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: If anything is poisoning our lives and weakening our society  it is reality - and not the fabrication of television writers and producers.
author: Martin Moloney

quote: There is no reality except the one contained within us. That is why so many people live such an unreal life. They take the images outside them for reality and never allow the world within to assert itself.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: Nothing which is at all times and in every way agreeable to us can have objective reality. It is of the very nature of the real that it should have sharp corners and rough edges  that it should be resistant  should be itself. Dream-furniture is the only kind on which you never stub your toes or bang your knee.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Facts as facts do not always create a spirit of reality  because reality is a spirit.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: We take our shape  it is true  within and against that cage of reality bequeathed us at our birth  and yet it is precisely through our dependence on this reality that we are most endlessly betrayed.
author: James Baldwin

quote: You too must not count overmuch on your reality as you feel it today  since  like that of yesterday  it may prove an illusion for you tomorrow.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: All our interior world is reality - and that perhaps more so than our apparent world.
author: Marc Chagall

quote: The field of consciousness is tiny. It accepts only one problem at a time. Get into a fist fight  put your mind on the strategy of the fight  and you will not feel the other fellow's punches.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: A life based on reason will always require to be balanced by an occasional bout of violent and irrational emotion  for the instinctual tribes must be satisfied.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Analysis kills spontaneity. The grain once ground into flour springs and germinates no more.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: I like reality. It tastes of bread.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: The time is comin' whin not more thin hath iv us'll be rale  an' th' rest'll be rubber  (plastic!)
author: Finley Peter Dunne

quote: To see what is in front of one's nose needs a constant struggle.
author: George Orwell

quote: We do not fight for the real but for shadows we make A flag is a piece of cloth and a word is a sound  But we make them something neither cloth nor a sound Tokens of love and hate  black sorcery stones.
author: Stephen Vincent Benet

quote: Where I cannot satisfy my reason  I love to humour my fancy.
author: Sir Thomas Browne

quote: When the human mind exists in the light of reason and no more than reason  we may say with absolute certainty that Man and all that made him will be in that instant gone.
author: Loren Eiseley

quote: I have hardly ever known a mathematician who was capable of reasoning.
author: Plato

quote: Reason is God's gift  but so are the passions. Reason is as guilty as passion.
author: Cardinal Newman

quote: The man who is master of his passions is Reason's slave.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Human reason needs only to will more strongly than fate  and she is fate.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: Reason deserves to be called a prophet  for in showing up the consequence and effect of our actions in the present  does it not tell us what the future will be?
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: The difference between the reason of man and the instinct of the beast is this  that the beast does but know  but the man knows that he knows.
author: John Donne

quote: Reason is also choice.
author: John Milton

quote: Reason is an emotion for the sexless.
author: Heathcote Williams

quote: The last advance of reason is to recognize that it is surpassed by innumerable things  it is feeble if it cannot realize that.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: All our reasoning ends in surrender to feeling.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Reason is the mistress and queen of all things.
author: Cicero

quote: He who will not reason  is a bigot  he who cannot is a fool  and he who dares not  is a slave.
author: William Drummond

quote: Reason can in general do more than blind force.
author: Gallus

quote: If I go to heaven I want to take my reason with me.
author: Charles J. Ingersoll

quote: Come now  and let us reason together.
author: Bible

quote: Error of opinion may be tolerated where reason is left free to combat it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Human reason is like a drunken man on horseback  set it up on one side  and it tumbles over on the other.
author: Martin Luther

quote: You know  my friends  with what a brave carouse I made a second marriage in my house  Divorced old barren reason from my bed  And took the daughter of the vine to spouse.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: The feast of reason and the flow of soul.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Every why hath a wherefore.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I have no other but a woman's reason. I think him so because I think him so.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Many are destined to reason wrongly  others  not to reason at all: and others to persecute those who do reason.
author: Voltaire

quote: There are so many people with all kinds of lucky things happening to them  and they don't know how to use it.
author: Rocky Aoki

quote: Probably any successful career has "X" number of breaks in it  and maybe the difference between successful people and those who aren't superachievers is taking advantage of those breaks.
author: Joan Ganz Cooney

quote: To get it right  be born with luck or else make it.
author: Ruth Gordon

quote: You must always be open to your luck. You cannot force it  but you can recognize it.
author: Henry Moore

quote: Genius is the gold in the mine  talent is the miner that works and brings it out.
author: Lady Marguerite Blessington

quote: It is one thing to be gifted and quite another thing to be worthy of one's own gift.
author: Nadia Boulanger

quote: Talent on its own sat gracefully only on the very young. After a certain age it was what you did with it that counted.
author: Liza Cody

quote: A wise man turns chance into good fortune.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Luck ... taps  once in a lifetime  at everybody's door  but if industry does not open it  luck goes away.
author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

quote: When something bad happens to me  I think I'm able to deal with it in a pretty good way. That makes me lucky. Some people fall apart at the first little thing that happens.
author: Christie Brinkley

quote: It's funny  but... you're sort of a moving target for fortune  and you never know when it will befall you.
author: Thomas McGuane

quote: Lady Luck generally woos those who earnestly  enthusiastically  unremittingly woo her.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: Luck is good planning  carefully executed.
author: Anonymous

quote: What helps luck is a habit of watching for opportunities  of having a patient  but restless mind  of sacrificing one's ease or vanity  of uniting a love of detail to foresight  and of passing through hard times bravely and cheerfully.
author: Charles Victor Cherbuliez

quote: Luck is believing you're lucky.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: I think that one can have luck if one tries to create an atmosphere of spontaneity.
author: Federico Fellini

quote: Each man's character shapes his fortunes.
author: Latin proverb

quote: Chance works for us when we are good captains.
author: George Meredith

quote: Motivation triggers luck.
author: Mike Wallace

quote: Good and bad luck is a synonym  in the great majority of instances  for good and bad judgment.
author: John Chatfield

quote: Luck is a combination of confidence and getting the breaks.
author: Christy Mathewson

quote: I was born lucky  and I have lived lucky. What I had was used. What I still have is being used. Lucky.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: Luck is largely a matter of paying attention.
author: Susan M. Dodd

quote: Your luck is how you treat people.
author: Bridget O'Donnell

quote: The only sure thing about luck is that it will change.
author: Bret Harte

quote: The man who glories in his luck may be overthrown by destiny.
author: Euripides

quote: There is in the worst of fortune the best of chances for a happy change.
author: Euripides

quote: It is more easy to get a favor from fortune than to keep it.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Since luck's a nine days' wonder  wait their end.
author: Euripides

quote: Fortune is with you for an hour  and against you for ten!
author: Arab proverb

quote: Breaks balance out. The sun don't shine on the same old dog's rear end every day.
author: Darrell Royal

quote: What the reason of the ant laboriously drags into a heap  the wind of accident will collect in one breath.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: Fortune is like the market  where many times  if you can stay a little  the price will fall.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: The profits of good luck are perishable  if you build on fortune  you build on sand  the more advancement you achieve  the more dangers you run.
author: Marquis de Racan

quote: Every possession and every happiness is but lent by chance for an uncertain time  and may therefore be demanded back the next hour.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Life is full of chances and changes  and the most prosperous of men may ... meet with great misfortunes.
author: Aristotle

quote: Reforms should begin at home and stay there.
author: Anonymous

quote: At twenty a man is full of fight and hope. He wants to reform the world. When he's seventy he still wants to reform the world  but he knows he can't.
author: Clarence S. Darrow

quote: We are reformers in Spring and Summer  in Autumn and Winter we stand by the old  reformers in the morning  conservers at night.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Reform must come from within  not from without. You cannot legislate for virtue.
author: James Cardinal Gibbons

quote: The hole and the patch should be commensurate.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: To make a crooked stick straight  we bend it the contrary way.
author: Michel Montaigne

quote: An indefinable something is to be done  in a way nobody knows how  at a time nobody knows when  that will accomplish nobody knows what.
author: Thomas B. Read

quote: Very frequently  feminine activity also expresses itself in what is largely a retrospectively oriented pondering over what we ought to have done differently in life  and how we ought to have done it  or  as if under compulsion  we make up strings of causal connections. We like to call this thinking  though  on the contrary  it is a form of mental activity that is strangely pointless and unproductive  a form that really leads only to self-torture.
author: Emma Jung

quote: The only causes of regret are laziness  outbursts of temper  hurting others  prejudice  jealousy  and envy.
author: Germaine Greer

quote: If you have behaved badly  repent  make what amends you can and address yourself to the task of behaving better next time. On no account brood over your wrongdoing. Rolling in the muck is not the best way of getting clean.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: You always feel when you look it straight in the eye that you could have put more into it  could have let yourself go and dug harder.
author: Emily Carr

quote: When one door closes another opens. But we often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door that we fail to see the one that has opened for us.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

quote: No doing without some ruing.
author: Sigrid Undset

quote: Nobody gets to live life backward. Look ahead  that is where your future lies.
author: Ann Landers

quote: Were it not better to forget Than to remember and regret?
author: L. E. Landon

quote: Regret for the things we did can be tempered by time  it is regret for the things we did not do that is inconsolable.
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: Always repenting of wrongs done will never bring my heart to rest.
author: Ji Kang

quote: Should-haves solve nothing. It's the next thing to happen that needs thinking about.
author: Alexandra Ripley

quote: The error of the past is the success of the future. A mistake is evidence that someone tried to do something.
author: Anonymous

quote: Regret is an appalling waste of energy  you can't build on it  it is good only for wallowing.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: I have always found that each step we take in life is to be regretted-if we once begin to wonder how many other steps might have been possible.
author: John Oliver Hobbes

quote: If you cannot get rid of the family skeleton  you may as well make it dance.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Let the dead Past bury its dead!
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: "The horror of that moment " the King went on  "I shall never forget." "You will  though " the Queen said  "if you don't make a memorandum of it."
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: Reflect upon your present blessings  of which every man has many-not on your past misfortunes  of which all men have some.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: They say you should not suffer through the past. You should be able to wear it like a loose garment  take it off and let it drop.
author: Eva Jessye

quote: Your past is always going to be the way it was. Stop trying to change it.
author: Anonymous

quote: The only thing I regret about my past is the length of it. If I had to live my life again  I'd make the same mistakes  only sooner.
author: Tallulah Bankhead

quote: There is no greater sorrow than to recall a happy time in the midst of wretchedness.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: We should have no regrets. ... The past is finished. There is nothing to be gained by going over it. Whatever it gave us in the experiences it brought us was something we had to know.
author: Rebecca Beard

quote: One must never lose time in vainly regretting the past or in complaining against the changes which cause us discomfort  for change is the essence of life.
author: Anatole France

quote: Yesterday's errors let yesterday cover.
author: Susan Coolidge
